alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 10 at 8:42AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Rivers draining the southeastern Brooks Range. This includes the middle fork of the Koyukuk River. * WHEN...Through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Runoff from rainfall and remaining snowmelt has caused rivers draining the southeastern Brooks Range to rise to near bankfull in many locations, with water over bank in some low lying areas. Minor flooding is occurring on Slate Creek at Coldfoot. Water is approaching the road into the community of Wiseman. Water levels will continue to rise into the weekend, possibly causing minor flooding in some locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The high water will cover gravel bars and push water up into the brush line. An increased amount of debris will flow down rivers. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
